chapter.title: Installing the operating system
chapter.para: The following section provides instructions for installing the base operating system. Using the installation workflow, you can install either using a local installation medium or over the network. Alternatively, you can install using &ay;.

sect1.title: Installation workflow
sect1.para: The installation workflow is a guided installation of the operating system with optimized settings for &sap; applications. During the installation workflow, you can choose whether you want to install an &sap; application. If so, you will be asked to provide &sap; installation media when the &sls; installation is finished. You can also choose whether to install third-party extensions.

This section assumes that you are starting the installation from a local medium.
To learn how to start the installation from a remote medium, see .
This section guides you through the installation of the &sles4sap; operating system.

important.title: Installing Oracle databases
important.para: To be able to install an Oracle database later, install &sles; first and then convert your installation to &sles4sap;.
This is necessary because the installer for Oracle databases queries for the existence of certain files, not all of which are included in a &s4sa; installation.
For more information about converting, see .

listitem.para: On &x86-64;, boot from the installation media. From the boot menu, select Installation.
On &power;, follow the instructions in the &sls; documentation, see &deploy;, Part Installation Preparation, Chapter Installation on IBM &power; (&docaddress;).

step.para: While the initial operating system is starting, you can view boot messages by pressing . When this process has completed, the graphical installation workflow will start. As the first step, the installation workflow will check for updates for itself. After that, it will be ready to start the installation.
Select the default system language under Language.
Select the appropriate keyboard layout under Keyboard Layout. To test whether the selected layout matches your physical keyboard, use the text box Keyboard Test.
&slea; &productnumber; provides a single installation ISO for the entire product line. Therefore, you need to select the product to install on this page.
Under Product to install, choose &s4s; &productnumber;.
Read the license agreement. If you agree, select I Agree to the License Terms. Proceed with Next.
Otherwise, cancel the installation with Abort Abort Installation.
If automatic network configuration via DHCP fails, the screen Network Settings will open.
If instead the screen Registration appears, your network connection works. To change network settings anyway, click Network Configuration.
When you are finished configuring networking, proceed with Next.

important.title: Configure networking as recommended by &sap;
important.para: Make sure to configure the network connection as recommended in the documentation provided to you by &sap;.

step.para:
For information about configuring networking, see
&admin;, Chapter Basic Networking, Section Configuring a Network Connection with YaST (&docaddress;).
On the screen Registration, enter your E-mail Address and Registration Code. Successful registration is a prerequisite for receiving product updates and the entitlement to technical support.
Proceed with Next.

important.title: Register at this step
important.para: Make sure to register your system at this step in the installation. Otherwise, you can only install a minimal &slea; system and will not receive updates.

To install a full (but not updated) &s4sa; system without network access during the installation, use the &slea; &productnumber; Packages ISO image from . You can then choose Skip registration on this page and select the &slea; &productnumber; Packages ISO image as an add-on product on the next page.

step.para: When asked whether to enable update repositories, choose Yes.

After the system is successfully registered, &yast; lists available modules for &productname; from the &scc;. The default selection covers the most common cases. To enable an additional module, activate its entry.

note.title: Release notes
note.para: From this point on, the release notes can be viewed from any screen during the installation process by selecting Release Notes.

step.para: Proceed with Next.

The Add On Product dialog allows you to add additional software sources (so-called repositories) to &productname;, that are not provided by the &scc;. Such add-on products may include third-party products, drivers, or additional software for your system.
Choose the System Role. System roles are predefined use cases which tailor the system for the selected scenario. For &sles4sap;, you can choose between:

listitem.para: &slsa; for &sap; Applications: Default, recommended for most situations. This system role contains the following properties:

&slsa; with GNOME: Can be necessary in specific cases. This installation path is not covered in this document. For more information about this installation path, see
&instquick;, Section Installing &sls; (&docaddress;).

step.para: Additional system roles are available for specific use cases (&ha;, text mode, minimal, and KVM/XEN virtualization hosts).
Proceed with Next.
Choose whether to enable the following options:

listitem.para: To install an &sap; Application along with the system, activate Launch the SAP Installation Wizard right after the operating system is installed.
To enable RDP access (Remote Desktop Protocol) to this machine, activate Enable RDP service and open port in firewall.
For more information about connecting via RDP, see .

step.para: Review the proposed partition setup for the volumes /dev/system/root and /dev/system/swap. The volume /dev/system/data will be created later, as described in .
Suitable values are preselected. However, if necessary, change the partition layout. You have the following options:

listitem.para: Create a new partitioning suggestion based on your input.
Open the Expert Partitioner described in Deployment Guide, Chapter Advanced Disk Setup, Section Using the YaST Partitioner (&docaddress;).
For partitioning advice specific to &sles4sap;, see .

step.para: To accept the proposed setup without changes, proceed with Next.

Select the clock and time zone to use on your system. To manually adjust the time or to configure an NTP server for time synchronization, choose Other Settings. For detailed information, see &deploy;, Chapter Installation with YaST, Section Clock and Time Zone (&docaddress;).
Proceed with Next.

Type a password for the system administrator account (called root) and repeat the password under Confirm Password. You can use the text box Test Keyboard Layout to make sure that all special characters appear correctly.

If you want to enable passwordless authentication via SSH login, you can import a key via Import Public SSH Key. If you want to completely disable &rootuser; login via password, upload a key only and do not provide a root password. A login as system administrator will only be possible via SSH using the respective key in this case.
For more information, see &deploy;, Chapter Installation with YaST, Section Password for the System Administrator root (&docaddress;).
Proceed with Next.

important.title: Do not forget the root password
important.para: The user root has the permission to carry out all administrative tasks. Without this password, you cannot log in to the system as root. The password entered here cannot be retrieved later.

step.para: On the screen Installation Settings, you can review and, if necessary, change several proposed installation settings. Each setting is shown alongside its current configuration. To change parts of the configuration, click the appropriate headline or other underlined items.

important.title: Firewall configuration
important.para: The software firewall of &productnameshort; is enabled by default. However, often, the ports your &sap; product requires to be open are not opened automatically. This means that there may be network issues until you open the required ports manually.

step.para: When you are satisfied with the system configuration, click Install.
Depending on your software selection, you may need to agree to further license agreements before you are asked to confirm that you want to start the installation process.

warning.title: Deletion of data
warning.para: The installation process fully or partially overwrites existing data on the disk.

step.para: In the installation confirmation box, click Install.
When the installation of the operating system is finished, the system will reboot automatically:

listitem.para: If you chose to only prepare the system for installation, the system will boot to a desktop login screen.
If you chose to install an &sap; application now, the installation will continue after a reboot. Continue with .

sect1.para: This section provides a short description of how to install from an installation medium served over the network. This allows, for example, using a regular &slsa; medium to install &productnameshort;.

step.para: Copy the content of the &sles4sap; installation media to a Web server (for example, example.com), to the directory /srv/www/htdocs/sap_repo.
Boot from an &slsa; installation medium.
Select one of the boot menu options using the keys /. Then add to the command line. To do so, specify the parameters listed below:

listitem.para: To allow network usage, add ifcfg=*=dhcp (though this should be the default).

step.para: Follow the instructions in .

sect1.para: For more information, see &deploy;, Chapter Remote Installation (&docaddress;).

To avoid having to use an &slsa; installation medium to initialize the system, you can boot over the network via PXE. For details, see &ay; Guide, Chapter Booting via PXE over the Network (&docaddress;).

sect1.title: Converting an &slsa; installation to a &s4sa; installation
sect1.para: To convert an installation of &sls; &productnumber; or &jeos; &productnumber; to an installation of &s4sa;, use the script Migrate_SLES_to_SLES-for-SAP.sh. The script will register the system correctly and subscribe it to the appropriate repositories.
Make sure that you have an e-mail address for registration and a registration code for &s4sa;.

step.para: Install the package migrate-sles-to-sles4sap.
Execute the following command:
When asked to confirm to continue the migration, press Y, then .
When asked, type the e-mail address to use for registration, then press .
When asked, type the registration key, then press .
Wait until the script is finished. Afterward, you are subscribed to the &s4s; software repositories and the package SLES-release is removed in favor of SLES_SAP-release.

important.title: Script does not install default &s4sa; packages
important.para: The script does not install all packages that are included with a default &s4sa; installation. However, you can install these yourself manually. To install the default package selection, use:

warning.title: Migration script on public cloud
warning.para: On public cloud instances (pay-as-you-go instances in particular), billing depends on internal mechanisms to identify the entitlement and to calculate the actual consumption. This makes the migration script ineffective, as it only performs migration of repositories inside the operating system.
To perform migration, you must follow image migration guidelines by your cloud solution provider.
